364001. The Treachery of Cochin

Calicut — Not random

Conditions

  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • All of the following must occur:
      • Event 260220 - Quarrel in Malabar for Portugal has already occurred
      • Portugal exists
    • Cochin is a vassal of Portugal

Will happen within 30 days of March 2, 1503
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1523)
unless prevented by
Action A of 355005 - Invasion for Cochin
Action B of 260220 - Quarrel in Malabar for Portugal

Description

Using Vasco Da Gama's attack as a smoke screen, the Raja of Cochin treacherously breaks his ties to the Samoothiri Kingdom of Calicut.

Actions

A. They Shall not Escape

  • Event 355001 - Samoothiri Invasion for Cochin is triggered immediately
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Cochin for 120 months
  • -100 relations with Cochin
  • -100 relations with Portugal

B. Who Needs Them

  • +100 relations with Cochin
  • +100 relations with Portugal

Back to top

364002. Anti-Portuguese Feelings

Calicut — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 260221 - Cochin Asks for Assistance for Portugal has already occurred
  • The following must not occur:
    • Event 364003 - Commercial Treaty with Portugal for Calicut has already occurred

Will happen within 30 days of March 2, 1503
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1533)

Description

Resentful of the Portuguese usurpation of their position in the Indian Ocean carrying trade as well as their loss of control over Cochin, the rulers of Calicut constantly intrigued against the Portuguese as well as occasionally attacking them.

Actions

A. Damn the Interlopers!

  • -200 relations with Portugal
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Portugal for 120 months

Back to top

364003. Commercial Treaty with Portugal

Calicut — Not random

Conditions

  • Portugal owns Cochin

Will happen within 30 days of March 2, 1513
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1523)

Description

After over a decade of hostility, Portugal and Calicut normalize relations with the signing of a treaty of peace, friendship, and commerce.

Actions

A. Sign the Treaty

  • +250 relations with Portugal
  • +200
  • +3 merchants
  • Event 260222 - Commercial Treaty with Calicut for Portugal is triggered immediately

B. Refuse the Treaty

  • -100 relations with Portugal

Back to top

364005. Assassination Attempt

Calicut — Not random

Conditions

  • Portugal owns Cochin

Will happen within 5000 days of January 2, 1524
Checked again every 5000 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1540)

Description

When an attempt was made on the King's life, Calicut's nobles suspected Portuguese instigation, ruining a decade's worth of detente between the two trading powers.

Actions

A. Unconscionable Swine!

  • -300 relations with Portugal
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Portugal for 120 months

Back to top

364006. Portuguese Factory at Calicut

Calicut — Not random

Conditions

  • Portugal owns Cochin

Will happen within 180 days of January 2, 1591
Checked again every 180 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1597)

Description

After years of fruitless hostility and economic hardship, Calicut finally agrees to accept a Portuguese factory within its walls.

Actions

A. Permit the Factory

  • +200 relations with Portugal
  • Cochin will no longer be considered a national province
  • +2 merchants

B. Maintain Hostility to Portugal

  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Portugal for 120 months
  • -2 merchants
  • -100

Back to top

364007. The Surrender of Kunjali Marakkar

Calicut — Not random

Conditions

  • Portugal exists
  • Event 364006 - Portuguese Factory at Calicut for Calicut has already occurred

Will happen within 700 days of January 2, 1598
Checked again every 700 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1600)

Description

Calicut's fearless naval commander Kunjali Marakkar has fought on against the Portuguese despite his government's decision to normalize relations with the colonial powers. Having apprehended Kunjali, Calicut's King now has the chance to turn him over to the Portuguese.

Actions

A. Give Kunjali to Portugal

  • +200 relations with Portugal
  • Leader Marakkar will never be active
  • Break vassalization with Vijayanagar
  • Event 364004 - Submission to Portugal for Calicut is triggered immediately

B. Free Kunjali

  • -100 relations with Portugal
  • -3 merchants
  • -200

Back to top

364000. Bombardment of Calicut

Calicut — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 260034 - Bombardment of Calicut for Portugal

Description

After refusing Vasco Da Gama's request that he eject all Muslim merchants from the city, Calicut finds itself under Portuguese attack. The market area of the city suffers substantial damage.

Actions

A. Confounded Swine!

  • -300 relations with Portugal
  • -6 merchants
  • -3000 population in the capital province
  • Event 355000 - Da Gama's Proposition for Cochin is triggered immediately

Back to top

364008. Dutch ascendancy in Malabar

Calicut — Not random

Conditions

  • Calicut is a vassal of Portugal

Triggered by

Action A of 260225 - The Loss of Cochin for Portugal

Description

Symptomatic of a larger decline in Portuguese fortunes, Cochin falls to Dutch forces in 1662.

Actions

A. Oh, well...

  • Cede Cochin to Netherlands
  • Break vassalization with Portugal
  • Stability +3

Back to top

364004. Submission to Portugal

Calicut — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 364007 - The Surrender of Kunjali Marakkar for Calicut

Description

With Kunjali Marakkar out of the way, our ruler is now free to submit to the Portuguese.

Actions

A. At last!

  • Event 260223 - Calicut is cowed for Portugal is triggered immediately
